thread.title: Reliance Jio To End Free Data Plan From 31 March
thread.title_full: Reliance Jio To End Free Data Plan From 31 March

author: Ivan Mehta
title: Reliance Jio To End Free Data Plan From 31 March

organizations.name: ivan mehta tech news editor bloomberg

text:
Reliance Jio To End Free Data Plan From 31 March Ambani announces ₹303 monthly plan, offering 1GB of free 4G data per day. 21/02/2017 6:28 PM IST | Updated 13 minutes ago Ivan Mehta Tech News Editor Bloomberg via Getty Images ADVERTISEMENT 
After offering almost six months of free services, Reliance Jio today announced a paid plan for users of its broadband and mobile telephony services. The premium plan offered by Jio will cost ₹303 per month and will offer the same benefits as the Happy New Year offer launched by the company in December. Reliance Industries chairman Mukesh Ambani made the announcement today in a live broadcast. 
Jio users will have access to free 4G data of up to 1GB every day, besides enjoying premium access to Jio apps and free voice calls. The cost per day to the user for these services comes to ₹10. Users will also have to pay a one-time signing-up fee of ₹99. Jio Prime Members can get this tremendous value at an introductory price of only Rs 303/month, effectively just Rs 10/day #100MillionOnJio — Reliance Jio (@reliancejio) February 21, 2017 
The new scheme will commence from 31 March and users signing up for this plan will be called Jio Prime Customers. Other existing users will still be able to enjoy the benefit of free voice calling. 
Jio Prime members will be able to enjoy the benefits of the Happy New Year offer until 31 March 2018. It is expected that the company will announce new plans at the time.
